question.text: The colonies of recombinant bacteria appear white in contrast to blue colonies of non-recombinant bacteria because of

options.text: Insertional inactivation of alpha-galactosidase in non-recombinant bacteria
Insertional inactivation of alpha-galactosidase in recombinant bacteria
Insertional inactivation of beta-galactosidase in recombinant bacteria.
Insertional inactivation of beta-galactosidase in non-recombinant bacteria.

solution.text:
Screenable marker, visual marker or reporter gene generates a product that can be detected. It is used in confirming transformation, determining transformation efficiency and monitoring gene expression. 

The most common example is the lac Z gene of E. coli. Lac Z gene acts as a screenable marker in the presence of X-gal because its expression is readily quantitated by the intensity of the blue colour that is generated.

Lac Z (reporter gene) → β-galactosidase (gene product) →X-gal (substrate) →1. Blue colonies  (non-transformants) 2. White colonies (transformants)
